#summary Muscles of Human Neck
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanMuscles] -> [HumanMusclesNeck]
----

This page is intended to list all muscles of biological human in the neck area.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

Coverage verified by:

  * http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_of_muscles_of_the_human_body

== Pharynx ==
(generated)

  * *Pharyngeal constrictor*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inferior_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Inferior pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={swallowing}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Middle pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={swallowing}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superior_pharyngeal_constrictor_muscle Superior pharyngeal constrictor muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={swallowing}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salpingopharyngeus_muscle Salpingopharyngeus muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial vagus nerve, pharyngeal plexus]}; ACTION={raise the nasopharynx}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stylopharyngeus_muscle Stylopharyngeus muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial glossopharyngeal nerve, stylopharyngeal branch]}; ACTION={elevate the larynx, elevate the pharynx, swallowing}

== Larynx ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aryepiglottic_muscle Aryepiglottic muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial recurrent laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={close the inlet}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arytenoid_muscle Arytenoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={approximate the arytenoid cartilages (close rima glottidis)}
  * *Cricoarytenoid muscle*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lateral_cricoarytenoid_muscle Lateral cricoarytenoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={adduct and medially rotate the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments towards the midline and backwards and so closing off the rima glottidis}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Posterior_cricoarytenoid_muscle Posterior cricoarytenoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={abducts and laterally rotates the cartilage, pulling the vocal ligaments away from the midline and forward and so opening the rima glottidis}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cricothyroid_muscle Cricothyroid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={tension and elongation of the vocal folds (has minor adductory effect)}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levator_muscle_of_thyroid_gland Levator muscle of thyroid gland]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, external]}; ACTION={elevates the thyroid gland}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oblique_arytenoid Oblique arytenoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={sphincter of the laryngeal inlet}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyroarytenoid_muscle Thyroarytenoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial inferior laryngeal nerve]}; ACTION={thickens the vocal folds and decreases length; also helps to adduct the vocal folds during speech}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyroepiglottic_muscle Thyroepiglottic muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial laryngeal nerve, internal]}; ACTION={closes the inlet to the larynx}

= TARGET.TEA.NECK =

== Cervical ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Platysma_muscle Platysma muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, cervical branch]}; ACTION={Draws the corners of the mouth inferiorly and widens it (as in expressions of sadness and fright). Also draws the skin of the neck superiorly when teeth are clenched}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternocleidomastoid_muscle Sternocleidomastoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial accessory nerve, external]}; ACTION={Acting alone, tilts head to its own side and rotates it so the face is turned towards the opposite side. Acting together, flexes the neck, raises the sternum and assists in forced inspiration.}

== Suprahyoid ==
(generated)

  * *Digastric muscle*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digastric_muscle Digastric muscle, facial]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, digastric branch]}; ACTION={opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digastric_muscle Digastric muscle, trigeminal]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial mylohyoid nerve]}; ACTION={opens the jaw when the masseter and the temporalis are relaxed}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geniohyoid_muscle Geniohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical nerve to geniohyoid]}; ACTION={carry hyoid bone and the tongue upward during deglutition}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mylohyoid_muscle Mylohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial mylohyoid nerve]}; ACTION={raises oral cavity floor, elevates hyoid, depresses mandible}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stylohyoid_muscle Stylohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesCranial facial nerve, stylohyoid branch]}; ACTION={elevate the hyoid during swallowing}

== Infrahyoid/Strap ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omohyoid_muscle Omohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, superior root]}; ACTION={Depresses the larynx and hyoid bone. Carries hyoid bone backward and to the side}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternohyoid_muscle Sternohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, inferior root]}; ACTION={depress hyoid bone}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sternothyroid_muscle Sternothyroid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical ansa cervicalis, inferior root]}; ACTION={elevates larynx, may slightly depress hyoid bone}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thyrohyoid_muscle Thyrohyoid muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical thyroid nerve]}; ACTION={depress hyoid bone}

== Vertebrate ==
(generated)

  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longus_capitis_muscle Longus capitis muscle]*; NERVE={[HumanNervesSpinalCervical C1-C4, upper cervical ventral spinal roots]}; ACTION={flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longus_colli_muscle Longus colli muscle]*; NERVELIST={C2, C3, C4, C5, C6}; ACTION={flexes the neck and head}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rectus_capitis_anterior_muscle Rectus capitis anterior muscle]*; NERVELIST={C1, C2}; ACTION={flexion of neck at atlanto-occipital joint}
  * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rectus_capitis_lateralis_muscle Rectus capitis lateralis muscle]*; NERVELIST={C1, C2}; ACTION={sidebend at atlanto-occipital joint}
  * *Scalene muscles*
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_anterior Scalenus anterior]*; NERVELIST={C5, C6}; ACTION={elevates first rib, rotate the neck to the opposite side}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_medius Scalenus medius]*; NERVELIST={C3, C4, C5, C6, C7, C8}; ACTION={elevate 1st rib, rotate the neck to the opposite sid}
   * *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scalenus_posterior Scalenus posterior]*; NERVELIST={C6, C7, C8}; ACTION={elevate 2nd rib, tilt the neck to the same side}
